error.signature: Warning: An update to Component inside a test was not wrapped in act(...)
error.regex: An update to \w+ inside a test was not wrapped in act

verdict.summary: State update in test not wrapped in act(). React 18 is stricter about batching updates in tests. All state-changing interactions must be wrapped in act().

dead_ends.action: Suppress the warning by mocking console.error
dead_ends.why_fails: Hides real issues; the test may pass but the component behavior is unreliable and updates may be lost

dead_ends.action: Add arbitrary waitFor or setTimeout calls without act()
dead_ends.why_fails: Timing-based fixes are flaky and do not guarantee React finishes processing updates

workarounds.action: Wrap state-triggering interactions in act() or use React Testing Library's async utilities
workarounds.how: await act(async () => { fireEvent.click(button); }); or use await screen.findByText('result');

workarounds.action: Use userEvent from @testing-library/user-event which wraps interactions in act() automatically

leads_to.condition: When tests run with StrictMode enabled causing unexpected double effects

preceded_by.condition: When hooks are used incorrectly in test setup, leading to act() warnings on subsequent updates

frequently_confused_with.distinction: react-act-warning is specifically about test-context act() wrapping, while act-warning can also appear in non-test contexts with concurrent features
